summary: Build a website where users can earn money by completing small tasks.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Bold platform hero banner with abstract geometric shapes and glowing green/indigo gradient accents on a dark background, suitable for a task-earning website (hero-banner.dim_1200x500.png)
- Flat illustration of a checklist with a coin reward icon, clean minimal style on a light background (task-reward-icon.dim_400x400.png)

existing_features.title: Create a visually rich homepage with a hero section featuring the cafe name, a tagline, and a call-to-action button (e.g., 'View Our Menu'). Include sections for About Us, Featured Items, and a Footer with contact details and opening hours.
Create a Menu page that displays food and drink items organized by category (e.g., Coffee, Tea, Snacks, Meals). Each item should show its name, a short description, and price.
Add a site-wide navigation bar with links to Home, Menu, and Contact sections/pages. The nav should be responsive and collapse gracefully on smaller screens.
Add a Contact section displaying the cafe's address, phone number, email, and opening hours. Include a simple contact form (name, email, message fields) that stores submissions in the backend.

Apply a warm, artisan cafe visual theme throughout the site. Use earthy tones (creams, warm browns, terracotta), elegant serif typography for headings, and a cozy, inviting layout. Maintain this style consistently across all pages.

Replace the existing homepage with a new landing page for the TaskEarn platform. Include a hero section with the platform name, a tagline (e.g., 'Complete small tasks. Earn real rewards.'), and a call-to-action button linking to the tasks page. Add a 'How It Works' section with three steps (Sign Up, Pick a Task, Get Paid) and a footer with platform links.

Create a Tasks page (route /tasks) that fetches and displays all available tasks from the backend. Each task card must show the task title, short description, reward amount (in tokens/points), and category badge. Include a category filter bar so users can filter tasks by category. Clicking a task card opens a detail view or modal with the full description and a 'Complete This Task' button that submits a completion record via the backend.

Implement Internet Identity–based authentication so users can log in and out. On login, call registerUser to ensure a profile exists. Show a 'Sign In' button in the navigation when unauthenticated and display the user's truncated principal and a 'Sign Out' button when authenticated. Gate the 'Complete This Task' action behind authentication — prompt unauthenticated users to sign in first.

Create a user Dashboard page (route /dashboard) accessible only to authenticated users. Display the user's current earned balance, a list of their completed tasks with completion date and reward earned, and a 'Request Withdrawal' form with an amount field that submits a withdrawal request to the backend. Show a summary card with total tasks completed and total earnings.

Apply a fresh, modern visual theme for the TaskEarn platform throughout all pages. Use a clean, energetic color palette with deep indigo and vibrant green accent tones, modern sans-serif typography, card-based layouts with subtle shadows, and clear visual hierarchy. Replace all existing cafe-themed styles (earthy browns, terracotta, serif fonts) with the new theme consistently across all components and pages.

Update the site-wide navigation bar to include links to Home, Tasks, and Dashboard. Remove cafe-specific links (Menu, Contact). The navigation should highlight the active route and remain responsive with a collapsible mobile menu.

new_feature_requests.summary: Task listing page showing available small tasks users can complete to earn money
User registration and login system to track earnings and task completions
User dashboard showing earned balance, completed tasks, and withdrawal options

Replace the existing cafe backend with a new backend actor that supports: user profiles (stored by principal) with a balance field; task definitions (id, title, description, reward amount, category, status); task completion records (taskId, userId, completedAt, approved); and contact/withdrawal request submissions. Provide functions: registerUser, getMyProfile, listAvailableTasks, submitTaskCompletion, getMyCompletions, getMyBalance, and requestWithdrawal.
